featured.text: These devices made it possible for doors to open by themselves and wine to flow magically out of statues’ mouths.
It must be free from impurity, while exhibiting some fruitiness and creating a pleasant bitter flavor along with a peppery sensation in the mouth.
Most families in Bekoji live from hand to mouth, and distance running offers the younger generation a way out.
Some studies suggest that the act of shaping our mouths into a smile (creating a “physical smile”) can help us see the brighter, funnier side of things.

The participants, having seen the visible tape-recorder turned off, paid no more attention to the microphones which stayed in front of their chairs, only a few inches from their mouths, thus giving excellent sound quality.

other.text: It is not exactly what a child eats that truly matters, but how much time it stays in his mouth.
They help to get rid of some bacteria in the mouth.
They stay in the mouth for a long time.
The longer the food stays in the mouth, the more likely cavities will develop.
Besides, chocolate contains tannins, which help to kill some of the bacteria in the mouth.
According to pediatric dentist Dr. Kaneta Lott, the most damaging stuff is something that is sticky or very hard and thus stays in the mouth for a long time.
Unlike hard candies, chocolate dissolves quickly in the mouth.
This is because we all have bacteria in our mouths.
As the wearer brings the food toward their mouth, the camera captures an image of the food.

definition.zh_def: 口腔的開口，通常用於進食、說話和呼吸。
definition.en_def: The opening in the face used for eating, speaking, and breathing.
definition.example: She smiled and opened her mouth to speak.
